      • parseCommand

        public void parseCommand​(java.lang.String command,
                         java.lang.String... params)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: Commands

        Compares input strings to local command list then calls appropriate method

        Example parseCommand boilerplate for Games

        public void parseCommand(String command, String... params) throws IllegalArgumentException{
            if(params.length == 0){
                if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("help")){System.out.println(help());}
                else{
                    throw new IllegalArgumentException("command not found");
                }
            }
            else {
                throw new IllegalArgumentException("No commands take this many parameters. Compare your command to the commands found by typing `help`");
            }
        }
        Specified by:
        parseCommand in interface Commands
        Parameters:
        command - String from user containing desired command
        params - String from user containing desired parameter(s)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Invalid command, parameter, or parameter count; .getMessage() should have details.

      • help

        public java.lang.String help()
        Description copied from interface: Commands

        Gets local commands, formats them into one string, then returns it.

        Specified by:
        help in interface Commands
        Returns:
        String of all commands, and all relevant information on them.
